programming_questions.question: If an algorithm performs addition before multiplication unless parentheses change the order, what is the result of following the steps: multiply 2 by 2, then add 3?
Which term represents a collection of characters used as input or output in many algorithms?
Which of the following best describes a language used to structure information for algorithmic processing?
Which symbol is commonly used to annotate or comment on steps in pseudocode or algorithm descriptions?
Which keyword is most often used to describe an operation that brings external data into an algorithm for processing?
Which algorithmic command conceptually removes an entire data collection from use?
In algorithmic modeling, what term describes the act of creating a new instance of a structured blueprint?
What is the time complexity of an algorithm that halves its search space on each iteration?
Which action describes modifying an existing data entry in a system modeled by algorithmic steps?
If a list contains three numbers and one nested list, how many top-level elements does an algorithm count when measuring length?
What is the best-case time complexity of an efficient divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm such as quicksort?
Which structure is used by algorithms to manage nested or deferred operations, especially in recursive computations?
What is the name of the algorithmic technique where a process invokes itself as part of its own execution?
What technique allows an algorithm to proceed with other tasks while waiting for a long-running operation to complete?
What is the algorithmic principle that ensures multiple simultaneous operations do not produce inconsistent results?
